Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Dr. Uma Mysorekar, The Hindu Temple Society of North America, 45-57 Bowne Street, Flushing N.Y. 11355.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koo.

The Invocation was delivered by: Dr. Uma Mysorekar, The Hindu Temple Society of North America, 45-57 Bowne Street, Flushing, N.Y. 11355.



Council Member Koo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application nos. C 140408 ZSM and C 140109 ZSM shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to Application no. N 140407 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Special Clinton District, Manhattan (N 140407 ZRM, C 140408 ZSM and C 140109 ZSM)

Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer affairs to provide young adults with outreach and education regarding consumer protection issues.

Items.MatterName: Dept of consumer affairs to provide young adults with outreach and education regarding consumer protection issues.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Education
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding students receiving special education services.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to report information regarding students receiving special education services.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 5750, Lot 500) the Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 186).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 186 - Schervier Apartments, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 1775, Lot 20) Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 187).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 187 - Tweemill House, Manhattan, Community District No.11, Council District No. 9.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to extending the rent stabilization laws.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extending the rent stabilization laws.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would create a review process for Individual Apartments Improvement rent increases and  make such increases a temporary surcharge rather than a permanent rent increase.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Create a review process for Individual Apartments Improvement rent increases and  make such increases a temporary surcharge rather than a permanent rent increase.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to approve, A.1865, in relation to repealing vacancy decontrol.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Repealing vacancy decontrol. (A.1865)

Items.Title: Resolution determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2015.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2015.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would end deregulation of rent regulated apartments.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: End deregulation of rent regulated apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.951, which repeals provisions of the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 that allow a 20 percent rent increase bonus after the vacancy of a tenant in a rent stabilized unit.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Repeals provisions of the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 that allow a 20 percent rent increase bonus after the vacancy of a tenant in a rent stabilized unit. (S.951)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.2830,  legislation amending the administrative code of the city of New York, the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 and the Emergency Housing Rent Control Law, in relation to making the Major Capital Improvement (MCI) rent increase a temporary surcharge.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 and the Emergency Housing Rent Control Law, in relation to making the Major Capital Improvement (MCI) rent increase a temporary surcharge. (S.2830)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.398, which will provide rent control tenants relief from high rent increases.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Provide rent control tenants relief from high rent increases.  (A.398)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.2828/A.3809, which prohibits property owners from adjusting the preferential rent amount upon the renewal of a lease for a rent stabilized unit.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Prohibits property owners from adjusting the preferential rent amount upon the renewal of a lease for a rent stabilized unit. (S.2828/A.3809)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A. 344 in relation to Mitchell-Lama and Project-Based Section 8 developments.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Mitchell-Lama and Project-Based Section 8 developments. (A.344)

Items.Title: Application No. C 130066 ZSM submitted by Goose Mountain NYC, LLC pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-711 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the applicable district use regulations to allow residential use on the property located at 498 Broome Street, within the Soho Cast-Iron Historic District, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Council District 1. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(2) or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to Charter Section 197-d(b)(3).

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the development of a guide for building owners regarding aging in place
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Requiring the development of a guide for building owners regarding aging in place.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to low energy intensity building requirements for certain capital projects
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Low energy intensity building requirements for certain capital projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.2828/A.3809, which prohibits property owners from adjusting the preferential rent amount upon the renewal of a lease for a rent stabilized unit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Prohibits property owners from adjusting the preferential rent amount upon the renewal of a lease for a rent stabilized unit. (S.2828/A.3809)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation to grant the City of New York the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Grant NYC the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation granting New York City the authority to set its own minimum wage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Granting NYC the authority to set its own minimum wage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.5501, strengthening the provisions of the Wage Theft Prevention Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Wage Theft Prevention Act. (A.5501)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to cooling centers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Cooling centers

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring a survey and study of racial, ethnic and gender diversity among the directors, officers and executive level staff members of city contractors
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Requiring a survey and study of racial, ethnic and gender diversity among the directors, officers and executive level staff members of city contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to racial diversity in the leadership of city contractors
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Racial diversity in the leadership of city contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the visitation of incarcerated individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a quarterly report regarding the visitation of incarcerated individuals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law A.4558B/S.61B, which would prohibit discrimination on the basis of gender expression or identity and expand the State's hate crimes statute to include offenses committed against someone on the basis of his or her gender expression or identity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibit discrimination on the basis of gender expression or identity. (A.4558B/S.61B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the American Psychological and American Psychiatric Associations to immediately pass resolutions declaring the practice of “curative therapy,” also known as “reparative” or “conversion” therapy, or any attempt to change, alter, or “correct” a person’s sexual orientation, to be unethical.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Declaring the practice of “curative therapy,” also known as “reparative” or “conversion” therapy, or any attempt to change, alter, or “correct” a person’s sexual orientation, to be unethical.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the permitted activities of home improvement contractors in regard to home improvement financing.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Permitted activities of home improvement contractors in regard to home improvement financing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to a disconnected youth workforce development program
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Workforce development.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a task force on disconnected youth.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Establishing a task force on disconnected youth.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to owner’s right of access.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Owner’s right of access.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to conduct community air quality surveys and publish the results annually
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to conduct community air quality surveys and publish the results annually.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring sight-seeing bus operators to submit operating plans to the department of consumer affairs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring sight-seeing bus operators to submit operating plans to the dept of consumer affairs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to mandating that the Mayor's Management Report include citizen satisfaction survey responses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Mandating that the Mayor's Management Report include citizen satisfaction survey responses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for New York’s working families
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for NY’s working families.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation requiring the Education Department/Board of Education in cities of one million people or more, where there is a Specialized High School Admission test policy requiring the taking of a ranked order test, to have a test preparation program available for all middle school students whose math and reading scores are level 4.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Specialized High School Test Preparation

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 150th anniversary of the death of President Abraham Lincoln on April 15, 2015.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of the death of President Abraham Lincoln on April 15, 2015.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 150th anniversary of the end of the American Civil War on April 9, 2015.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of the end of the American Civil War on April 9, 2015.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would end deregulation of rent regulated apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: End deregulation of rent regulated apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A. 344 in relation to Mitchell-Lama and Project-Based Section 8 developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Mitchell-Lama and Project-Based Section 8 developments. (A.344)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to install rear wheel guards on its buses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to install rear wheel guards on its buses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.951, which repeals provisions of the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 that allow a 20 percent rent increase bonus after the vacancy of a tenant in a rent stabilized unit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Repeals provisions of the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 that allow a 20 percent rent increase bonus after the vacancy of a tenant in a rent stabilized unit. (S.951)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing civil penalties for theft of a bicycle or motor vehicle.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establishing civil penalties for theft of a bicycle or motor vehicle.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the mayor to develop a plan for mapping all existing underground infrastructure.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the mayor to develop a plan for mapping all existing underground infrastructure.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for idling infractions and enforcement through citizen complaints
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for idling infractions and enforcement through citizen complaints.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.398, which will provide rent control tenants relief from high rent increases.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Provide rent control tenants relief from high rent increases.  (A.398)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the duration of inspection fees for certain recurring violations of the housing maintenance code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Duration of inspection fees for certain recurring violations of the housing maintenance code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the Department of Education to report the school-by-school ratio of school safety officers to guidance counselors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOE to report the school-by-school ratio of school safety officers to guidance counselors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor to apply for the enrollment of New York City in the Federal Emergency Management Agency’s Community Rating System.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Recovery and Resiliency
Items.MatterName: Mayor to apply for the enrollment of NYC in the Federal Emergency Management Agency’s Community Rating System.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a website for new and expecting parents.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Creation of a website for new and expecting parents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to minimum temperatures required to be maintained in dwellings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Minimum temperatures required to be maintained in dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to green building standards for certain capital projects, and to repeal section 3 of local law number 86 for the year 2005, relating to certain reporting requirements
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Green building standards for certain capital projects, and to repeal section 3 of local law number 86 for the year 2005, relating to certain reporting requirements.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.2830,  legislation amending the administrative code of the city of New York, the Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 and the Emergency Housing Rent Control Law, in relation to making the Major Capital Improvement (MCI) rent increase a temporary surcharge.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Emergency Tenant Protection Act of 1974 and the Emergency Housing Rent Control Law, in relation to making the Major Capital Improvement (MCI) rent increase a temporary surcharge. (S.2830)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exempting or partially exempting seniors and certain persons with disabilities from penalties for failing to remove snow or ice from sidewalks, crosswalks, curbs and other locations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Exempting or partially exempting seniors and certain persons with disabilities from penalties for failing to remove snow or ice from sidewalks, crosswalks, curbs and other locations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation to implement President Barack Obama’s “America’s College Promise” plan to make two years of community college free to anyone who maintains a 2.5 GPA and calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation funding the State’s obligation under the plan.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Matteo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: America’s College Promise

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).
